content: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - It takes the exit of dozens of advertisers and numerous protests to force change at Twenty-First Century Fox  it seems. The company on Wednesday parted ways with top Fox News anchor Bill O’Reilly in the wake of the criticism and lost ad dollars that followed a New York Times report cataloging sexual-harassment allegations he and Fox had settled. The U.S. cable channel’s chief architect  Roger Ailes  was booted amid a similar scandal nine months ago. The cleanup
name: O'Reilly Automotive Inc
title: Belated O’Reilly exit shows Fox still on back foot
